The '2012 [[NASCAR]] [[Sprint Cup Series]]' was the 64th season of professional
stock car racing in the United States. The season started on February 18, 2012
at Daytona International Speedway, with the Budweiser Shootout, followed by the
Daytona 500 on February 27. The season continued with the Chase for the Sprint
Cup beginning on September 16 at Chicagoland Speedway and concluded with the
Ford EcoBoost 400 on November 18 at Homestead-Miami Speedway.

During the 2011 season, NASCAR announced the Sprint Cup Series would be changing
to fuel injection from carburetors, which had been used since NASCAR's founding
in 1949. Sprint Nextel announced at the 2011 Awards Ceremony that they had
extended their sponsorship of the series until 2016. Roger Penske won the
Owners' Championship, while Brad Keselowski won the Drivers' Championship at the
final race of the season. Chevrolet won the Manufacturers' Championship with 249
points. Stephen Leicht was the 2012 NASCAR Rookie of the Year after beating Josh
Wise.
